00161                 flush();
00162                 //note that _root can be  NULL, if there is no items.           
00163                 if (_root) {
00164                         _root->unload();
00165                         delete _root;
00166                         _root = 0;
00167                 }
00168                 if (_dataFile != 0) {
00169                         fflush(_dataFile);
00170                         fclose(_dataFile);
00171                         _dataFile = 0;
00172                 }
00173                 return true;
00174         }

00289         void commit() {
00290                 _flush(_root, _dataFile);
00291 
00292                 if(_root)
00293                 _sfh.rootPos = _root->fpos;
00294 
00295                 if( !_dataFile )return;
00296

00298                         abort();
00299                 }
00300 
00301                 //write back the fileHead later, for overflow may occur when
00302                 //flushing.
00303                 _sfh.toFile(_dataFile);
00304 
00305                 /*while( !_dirtyPages.empty() )
00306                  {
00307                  sdb_node* ptr = _dirtyPages.back();
00308                  _dirtyPages.pop_back();
00309                  ptr->write(_dataFile);
00310                  }*/
00311                 fflush(_dataFile);
00312         }

00354         void _flushCache(bool quickFlush=false) {
00355                 if( sdb_node::activeNodeNum> _sfh.cacheSize )
00356                 {
00357                         _flushCacheImpl(quickFlush);
00358                 }
00359         }
00360 
00361         //for seq, reset SDBCursor
00362         void _flushCache(SDBCursor locn) {
00363                 if( sdb_node::activeNodeNum> _sfh.cacheSize )
00364                 {
00365                         KeyType key;
00366                         ValueType value;
00367                         get(locn, key, value);
00368                         _flushCacheImpl();
00369                         search(key, locn);
00370                 }
00371         }
00372 
00373         void _flushCacheImpl(bool quickFlush=false) {
00374 
00375                 if( !quickFlush )
00376                 commit();
00377 #ifdef  DEBUG
00378                 cout<<"cache is full..."<<endl;
00379                 cout<<sdb_node::activeNodeNum<<" vs "<<_sfh.cacheSize <<endl;
00380                 //display();
00381 #endif
00382 
00383                 queue<sdb_node*> qnode;
00384                 qnode.push(_root);
00385 
00386                 size_t popNum = 0;
00387                 size_t escapeNum = _sfh.cacheSize>>1;
00388                 sdb_node* interval = NULL;
00389                 while ( !qnode.empty() ) {
00390                         sdb_node* popNode = qnode.front();
00391                         qnode.pop();
00392                         popNum++;
00393 
00394                         if (popNode && !popNode->isLeaf) {
00395                                 for(size_t i=0; i<popNode->objCount+1; i++)
00396                                 {
00397                                         if(popNode->children[i] && popNode->children[i]->objCount>0 ) {
00398                                                 qnode.push( popNode->children[i] );
00399                                         }
00400                                 }
00401                         }
00402 
00403                         if( popNum >= escapeNum )
00404                         {
00405                                 if( popNode == interval )
00406                                 break;
00407 
00408                                 if( interval == NULL && !popNode->isLeaf ) {
00409                                         interval = popNode->children[0];
00410                                 }
00411 
00412                                 if( popNode->isDirty && quickFlush)
00413                                 _flush(popNode, _dataFile);
00414                                 popNode->unload();
00415                                 
00416                                 //cout<<"unloading....";
00417                                 //cout<<sdb_node::activeNodeNum<<" vs "<<_sfh.cacheSize <<endl;                                 
00418                         }
00419 
00420                 }
00421 #ifdef DEBUG
00422                 cout<<"stop unload..."<<endl;
00423                 cout<<sdb_node::activeNodeNum<<" vs "<<_sfh.cacheSize <<endl;
00424                 //display();
00425 #endif          
00426                 fflush(_dataFile);
00427 
00428         }
00429 
00430         sdb_node* _allocateNode() {
00431 
00432                 sdb_node* newNode;
00433 
00434                 newNode = new sdb_node;
00435                 newNode->isLoaded = true;
00436                 newNode->isDirty = true;
00437                 newNode->fpos = sizeof(CbFileHeader)+2*sizeof(size_t) + _sfh.pageSize
00438                 *(CbFileHeader::nPages+CbFileHeader::oPages);
00439 
00440                 //cout<<"allocate idx="<<CbFileHeader::nPages<<" "<<newNode->fpos;
00441                 CbFileHeader::nPages++;
00442                 sdb_node::activeNodeNum++;
00443 
00444                 //pre allocate memory for newNode for efficiency
00445                 newNode->keys.resize(_sfh.maxKeys);
00446                 newNode->values.resize(_sfh.maxKeys);
00447                 newNode->children.resize(_sfh.maxKeys+1);
00448 
00449                 return newNode;
00450         }

00461         // Finds the location of the predecessor of this key, given
00462         // the root of the subtree to search. The predecessor is going
00463         // to be the right-most object in the right-most leaf node.
00464         SDBCursor _findPred(sdb_node* node) {
00465                 SDBCursor ret(NULL, (size_t)-1);
00466                 sdb_node* child = node;
00467                 while (!child->isLeaf) {
00468                         child = child->loadChild(child->objCount, _dataFile);
00469                 }
00470                 ret.first = child;
00471                 ret.second = child->objCount - 1;
00472                 return ret;
00473         }
00474 
00475         // Finds the location of the successor of this key, given
00476         // the root of the subtree to search. The successor is the
00477         // left-most object in the left-most leaf node.
00478         SDBCursor _findSucc(sdb_node* node) {
00479                 SDBCursor ret(NULL, (size_t)-1);
00480                 sdb_node* child = node;
00481                 while (!child->isLeaf) {
00482                         child = child->loadChild(0, _dataFile);
00483                 }
00484                 ret.first = child;
00485                 ret.second = 0;
00486                 return ret;
00487         }
00488

00492 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00493                 typename Alloc> sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::sdb_btree(
00494                 const std::string& fileName) {
00495         _root = 0;
00496         _isDelaySplit = true;
00497         _fileName = fileName;
00498 
00499         int len = _fileName.size();
00500         if (_fileName[len-1] == '#') {
00501                 _isDelaySplit = false;
00502                 _fileName.erase(len-1);
00503         }
00504         _dataFile = 0;
00505         _cacheSize = 0;
00506         _isOpen = false;
00507 
00508 }

00514 
00515 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00516                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::search(
00517                 const KeyType& key, SDBCursor& locn) {
00518         //do Flush, when cache is full
00519         _flushCache();
00520 
00521         locn.first = 0;
00522         locn.second = (size_t)-1;
00523 
00524         sdb_node* temp = _root;
00525         while (1) {
00526                 int i = temp->objCount;
00527                 int low = 0;
00528                 int high = i-1;
00529                 int compVal;
00530                 while (low <= high) {
00531                         int mid = (low+high)/2;
00532                         compVal = _comp(key, temp->keys[mid]);
00533                         if (compVal == 0) {
00534                                 locn.first = temp;
00535                                 locn.second = mid;
00536                                 return true;
00537                         } else if (compVal < 0)
00538                                 high = mid-1;
00539                         else {
00540                                 low = mid+1;
00541                         }
00542                 }
00543 
00544                 if (!temp->isLeaf) {
00545                         temp = temp->loadChild(low, _dataFile);
00546                 } else {
00547                         locn.first = temp;
00548                         locn.second = low;
00549                         break;
00550                 }
00551         }
00552         return false;
00553 }
00554 
00555 // Splits a child node, creating a new node. The median value from the
00556 // full child is moved into the *non-full* parent. The keys above the
00557 // median are moved from the full child to the new child.
00558 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00559                 typename Alloc> void sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_split(
00560                 sdb_node* parent, size_t childNum, sdb_node* child) {
00561 
00562         //display();
00563         size_t i = 0;
00564         size_t leftCount = (child->objCount)>>1;
00565         size_t rightCount = child->objCount-1-leftCount;
00566         sdb_node* newChild = _allocateNode();
00567         newChild->childNo = childNum+1;
00568 
00569         newChild->isLeaf = child->isLeaf;
00570         newChild->setCount(rightCount);
00571 
00572         // Put the high values in the new child, then shrink the existing child.
00573         for (i = 0; i < rightCount; i++) {
00574                 newChild->keys[i] = child->keys[leftCount +1 + i];
00575                 newChild->values[i] = child->values[leftCount +1 + i];
00576         }
00577 
00578         if (!child->isLeaf) {
00579                 for (i = 0; i < rightCount+1; i++) {
00580                         sdb_node* mover = child->children[leftCount +1 + i];
00581                         newChild->children[i] = mover;
00582                         mover->childNo = i;
00583                         mover->parent = newChild;
00584                 }
00585         }
00586 
00587         KeyType savekey = child->keys[leftCount];
00588         ValueType savevalue = child->values[leftCount];
00589         child->setCount(leftCount);
00590 
00591         // Move the child pointers above childNum up in the parent
00592         parent->setCount(parent->objCount + 1);
00593         for (i = parent->objCount; i> childNum + 1; i--) {
00594                 parent->children[i] = parent->children[i - 1];
00595                 //if(parent->children[i]) 
00596                 parent->children[i]->childNo = i;
00597         }
00598         parent->children[childNum + 1] = newChild;
00599         newChild->childNo = childNum + 1;
00600         newChild->parent = parent;
00601 
00602         for (i = parent->objCount - 1; i> childNum; i--) {
00603                 parent->keys[i] = parent->keys[i - 1];
00604                 parent->values[i] = parent->values[i - 1];
00605         }
00606         parent->keys[childNum] = savekey;
00607         parent->values[childNum] = savevalue;
00608         child->setDirty(1);
00609         newChild->setDirty(1);
00610         parent->setDirty(1);
00611 
00612         //cout<<"after split !!!!"<<endl;
00613         //display();
00614 
00615         //_dirtyPages.push_back(child);
00616         //_dirtyPages.push_back(newChild);
00617         //_dirtyPages.push_back(parent);
00618 
00619 }
00620 //split two full leaf nodes into tree 2/3 ful nodes.
00621 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00622                 typename Alloc> void sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_split3Leaf(
00623                 sdb_node* parent, size_t childNum) {
00624 
00625         size_t i = 0;
00626         size_t count1 = (_sfh.maxKeys<<1)/3;
00627         size_t count2 = _sfh.maxKeys - _sfh.maxKeys/3-1;
00628         size_t count3 = (_sfh.maxKeys<<1) -1 -count1 -count2;
00629 
00630         sdb_node* child1 = parent->loadChild(childNum, _dataFile);
00631         sdb_node* child2 = parent->loadChild(childNum+1, _dataFile);
00632 
00633         sdb_node* newChild = _allocateNode();
00634         newChild->isLeaf =true;
00635         newChild->setCount(count3);
00636         newChild->parent = parent;
00637 
00638         KeyType tkey1 = child1->keys[(_sfh.maxKeys<<1)/3];
00639         ValueType tvalue1 = child1->values[(_sfh.maxKeys<<1)/3];
00640         KeyType tkey2 = child2->keys[_sfh.maxKeys/3];
00641         ValueType tvalue2 = child2->values[_sfh.maxKeys/3];
00642 
00643         // Put the high values in the new child, then shrink the existing child.
00644         for (i = 0; i < _sfh.maxKeys - count1 -1; i++) {
00645                 newChild->keys[i] = child1->keys[count1+1+i];
00646                 newChild->values[i] = child1->values[count1+1+i];
00647         }
00648 
00649         newChild->keys[ _sfh.maxKeys - count1 -1] = parent->keys[childNum];
00650         newChild->values[ _sfh.maxKeys - count1 -1] = parent->values[childNum];
00651 
00652         for (i = _sfh.maxKeys - count1; i < count3; i++) {
00653                 newChild->keys[i] = child2->keys[i-_sfh.maxKeys+count1];
00654                 newChild->values[i] = child2->values[i-_sfh.maxKeys+count1];
00655         }
00656 
00657         for (i=0; i<count2; i++) {
00658                 child2->keys[i] = child2->keys[_sfh.maxKeys/3+1+i];
00659                 child2->values[i] = child2->values[_sfh.maxKeys/3+1+i];
00660         }
00661 
00662         child1->setCount(count1);
00663         child2->setCount(count2);
00664 
00665         // Move the child pointers above childNum up in the parent
00666         parent->setCount(parent->objCount + 1);
00667         parent->keys[childNum] = tkey1;
00668         parent->values[childNum] = tvalue1;
00669 
00670         for (i = parent->objCount; i> childNum + 2; i--) {
00671                 parent->children[i] = parent->children[i - 1];
00672                 parent->children[i]->childNo = i;
00673         }
00674         parent->children[childNum + 1] = newChild;
00675         newChild->childNo = childNum + 1;
00676 
00677         for (i = parent->objCount-1; i> childNum+1; i--) {
00678                 parent->keys[i] = parent->keys[i - 1];
00679                 parent->values[i] = parent->values[i - 1];
00680         }
00681         parent->keys[childNum+1] = tkey2;
00682         parent->values[childNum+1] = tvalue2;
00683         parent->children[childNum+2] = child2;
00684         child2->childNo = childNum+2;
00685 
00686         child1->setDirty(1);
00687         child2->setDirty(1);
00688         newChild->setDirty(1);
00689         parent->setDirty(1);
00690 }
00691 
00692 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00693                 typename Alloc> sdb_node_<KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>* sdb_btree<
00694                 KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_merge(sdb_node* &parent,
00695                 size_t objNo) {
00696         //cout<<"befor merge...\n";
00697         //display();
00698 
00699         size_t i = 0;
00700         sdb_node* c1 = parent->loadChild(objNo, _dataFile);
00701         sdb_node* c2 = parent->loadChild(objNo+1, _dataFile);
00702         size_t _minDegree = _sfh.maxKeys/3;
00703 
00704         for (i = 0; i < _minDegree - 1; i++) {
00705                 c1->keys[_minDegree+i] = c2->keys[i];
00706                 c1->values[_minDegree+i] = c2->values[i];
00707 
00708         }
00709         if (!c2->isLeaf) {
00710                 for (i = 0; i < _minDegree; i++) {
00711                         size_t newPos = _minDegree + i;
00712                         c2->loadChild(i, _dataFile);
00713                         c1->children[newPos] = c2->children[i];
00714                         c1->children[newPos]->childNo = newPos;
00715                         c1->children[newPos]->parent = c1;//wps add it!                         
00716                 }
00717         }
00718 
00719         // Put the parent into the middle
00720         //c1->elements[_minDegree - 1] = parent->elements[objNo];
00721 
00722         c1->keys[_minDegree-1] = parent->keys[objNo];
00723         c1->values[_minDegree-1] = parent->values[objNo];
00724         c1->setCount(2*_minDegree-1);
00725 
00726         // Reshuffle the parent (it has one less object/child)
00727         for (i = objNo + 1; i < parent->objCount; i++) {
00728                 parent->keys[i-1] = parent->keys[i];
00729                 parent->values[i-1] = parent->values[i];
00730                 parent->loadChild(i+1, _dataFile);
00731                 parent->children[i] = parent->children[i + 1];
00732                 parent->children[i]->childNo = i;
00733         }
00734         parent->setCount(parent->objCount-1);
00735 
00736         if (parent->objCount == 0) {
00737                 parent = c1;
00738         }
00739 
00740         // Note that c2 will be release. The node will be deallocated
00741         // and the node's location on
00742         // disk will become inaccessible. 
00743 
00744         c2->unloadself();
00745         delete c2;
00746         c2 = 0;
00747 
00748         c1->setDirty(1);
00749         parent->setDirty(_dataFile);
00750 
00751         // Return a pointer to the new child.
00752         return c1;
00753 }
00754 
00755 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00756                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::insert(
00757                 const KeyType& key, const ValueType& value) {
00758         _flushCache();
00759         if (_root->objCount >= _sfh.maxKeys) {
00760                 // Growing the tree happens by creating a new
00761                 // node as the new root, and splitting the
00762                 // old root into a pair of children.
00763                 sdb_node* oldRoot = _root;
00764 
00765                 _root = _allocateNode();
00766                 _root->setCount(0);
00767                 _root->isLeaf = false;
00768                 _root->children[0] = oldRoot;
00769                 oldRoot->childNo = 0;
00770                 oldRoot->parent = _root;
00771                 _split(_root, 0, oldRoot);
00772                 goto L0;
00773         } else {
00774                 L0: register sdb_node* node = _root;
00775 
00776                 L1: register size_t i = node->objCount;
00777                 register int low = 0;
00778                 register int high = i-1;
00779                 register int mid;
00780                 register int compVal;
00781                 while (low<=high) {
00782                         mid = (low+high)>>1;
00783                         compVal = _comp(key, node->keys[mid]);
00784                         if (compVal == 0)
00785                                 return false;
00786                         else if (compVal < 0)
00787                                 high = mid-1;
00788                         else {
00789                                 low = mid+1;
00790                         }
00791                 }
00792 
00793                 // If the node is a leaf, we just find the location to insert
00794                 // the new item, and shuffle everything else up.
00795                 if (node->isLeaf) {
00796                         node->setCount(node->objCount + 1);
00797                         for (; (int)i> low; i--) {
00798                                 //cout<<node->keys[i-1]<<endl;
00799                                 node->keys[i] = node->keys[i-1];
00800                                 node->values[i] = node->values[i-1];
00801                         }
00802                         node->keys[low] = key;
00803                         node->values[low] = value;
00804                         node->setDirty(1);
00805 
00806                         ++_sfh.numItems;
00807                         return true;
00808 
00809                 }
00810 
00811                 // If the node is an internal node, we need to find
00812                 // the location to insert the value ...
00813                 else {
00814                         // Load the child into which the value will be inserted.
00815                         sdb_node* child = node->loadChild(low, _dataFile);
00816 
00817                         //If the child node is full , we will insert into its adjacent nodes, and if bothe are
00818                         //are full, we will split the two node to three nodes.                  
00819                         if (child->objCount >= _sfh.maxKeys) {
00820                                 if ( !child->isLeaf || !_isDelaySplit) {
00821                                         _split(node, low, child);
00822                                         compVal = _comp(key, node->keys[low]);
00823                                         if (compVal == 0)
00824                                                 return false;
00825                                         if (compVal> 0) {
00826                                                 ++low;
00827                                         }
00828                                         child = node->loadChild(low, _dataFile);
00829                                 } else {
00830                                         sdb_node* adjNode;
00831                                         int splitNum = low;
00832                                         if ((size_t)low < node->objCount) {
00833                                                 adjNode = node->loadChild(low+1, _dataFile);
00834                                                 if (adjNode->objCount < _sfh.maxKeys) {
00835 
00836                                                         //case: child's last key equal inserting key
00837                                                         if (_comp(child->keys[child->objCount-1], key)==0) {
00838                                                                 return false;
00839                                                         }
00840                                                         adjNode->setCount(adjNode->objCount+1);
00841                                                         for (size_t j=child->objCount-1; j>0; j--) {
00842                                                                 adjNode->keys[j] = adjNode->keys[j-1];
00843                                                                 adjNode->values[j] = adjNode->values[j-1];
00844                                                         }
00845                                                         adjNode->keys[0] = node->keys[low];
00846                                                         adjNode->values[0] = node->values[low];
00847                                                         adjNode->setDirty(true);
00848                                                         node->setDirty(true);
00849 
00850                                                         //case: all of the keys in child are less than inserting keys.
00851                                                         if (_comp(child->keys[child->objCount-1], key)<0) {
00852                                                                 node->keys[low] = key;
00853                                                                 node->values[low] = value;
00854                                                                 ++_sfh.numItems;
00855                                                                 return true;
00856 
00857                                                         }
00858 
00859                                                         //case: insert the item into the new child.                                                     
00860                                                         node->keys[low] = child->keys[child->objCount-1];
00861                                                         node->values[low]
00862                                                                         = child->values[child->objCount-1];
00863                                                         child->setDirty(true);
00864                                                         child->setCount(child->objCount-1);
00865                                                         node = child;
00866 
00867                                                         goto L1;
00868                                                 }
00869                                         }
00870 
00871                                         //case: the right sibling is full or no right sibling
00872                                         if (low>0) {
00873                                                 adjNode = node->loadChild(low-1, _dataFile);
00874                                                 //case: left sibling is no full
00875                                                 if (adjNode->objCount < _sfh.maxKeys) {
00876                                                         //cacheL child's first key equal inserting key,do nothing
00877                                                         if (_comp(child->keys[0], key) == 0) {
00878                                                                 return false;
00879                                                         }
00880 
00881                                                         adjNode->setCount(adjNode->objCount+1);
00882                                                         adjNode->keys[adjNode->objCount-1]
00883                                                                         = node->keys[low-1];
00884                                                         adjNode->values[adjNode->objCount-1]
00885                                                                         = node->values[low-1];
00886                                                         adjNode->setDirty(true);
00887                                                         node->setDirty(true);
00888                                                         //case: all of the keys in child are bigger than inserting keys.
00889                                                         if (_comp(key, child->keys[0])< 0) {
00890                                                                 node->keys[low-1] = key;
00891                                                                 node->values[low-1] = value;
00892                                                                 ++_sfh.numItems;
00893                                                                 return true;
00894                                                         }
00895                                                         node->keys[low-1] = child->keys[0];
00896                                                         node->values[low-1] = child->values[0];
00897 
00898                                                         //insert key into child, child's firt item is already put to its parent
00899                                                         size_t j=1;
00900                                                         bool ret=true;
00901                                                         child->setDirty(true);
00902                                                         for (; j<child->objCount; j++) {
00903                                                                 //inserting key exists, mark it
00904                                                                 if (_comp(child->keys[j], key) == 0) {
00905                                                                         ret = false;
00906                                                                 }
00907                                                                 //have found the right place for inserting key.
00908                                                                 if (ret && _comp(child->keys[j], key)>0) {
00909                                                                         child->keys[j-1] = key;
00910                                                                         child->values[j-1] = value;
00911                                                                         ++_sfh.numItems;
00912                                                                         return true;
00913                                                                 }
00914                                                                 child->keys[j-1] = child->keys[j];
00915                                                                 child->values[j-1] = child->values[j];
00916                                                         }
00917                                                         //inserting key exists
00918                                                         if ( !ret) {
00919                                                                 child->setCount(child->objCount-1);
00920                                                                 return false;
00921                                                         }
00922                                                         //insert the key at last positon of child
00923                                                         child->keys[j-1] = key;
00924                                                         child->values[j-1] = value;
00925                                                         ++_sfh.numItems;
00926                                                         return true;
00927                                                 }
00928                                         }
00929 
00930                                         //case: both nodes are full
00931                                         if ( (size_t)splitNum >0) {
00932                                                 splitNum = splitNum -1;
00933                                         }
00934                                         _split3Leaf(node, splitNum);
00935 
00936                                         if (_comp(node->keys[splitNum], key) == 0)
00937                                                 return false;
00938                                         if (_comp(node->keys[splitNum+1], key) == 0)
00939                                                 return false;
00940                                         if (_comp(key, node->keys[splitNum]) < 0) {
00941                                                 child = node->loadChild(splitNum, _dataFile);
00942                                         } else if (_comp(key, node->keys[splitNum+1]) <0) {
00943                                                 child=node->loadChild(splitNum+1, _dataFile);
00944                                         } else {
00945                                                 child=node->loadChild(splitNum+2, _dataFile);
00946                                         }
00947                                 }
00948                         }
00949                         // Insert the key (recursively) into the non-full child
00950                         // node.
00951                         node = child;
00952                         goto L1;
00953                 }
00954         }
00955 }
00956 
00957 // Write all nodes in the tree to the file given.
00958 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00959                 typename Alloc> void sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_flush(
00960                 sdb_node* node, FILE* f) {
00961 
00962         // Bug out if the file is not valid
00963         if (!f) {
00964                 return;
00965         }
00966         queue<sdb_node*> qnode;
00967         qnode.push(node);
00968         while (!qnode.empty()) {
00969                 sdb_node* popNode = qnode.front();
00970                 if (popNode && popNode->isLoaded) {
00971                         popNode->write(f);
00972                 }
00973                 qnode.pop();
00974                 if (popNode && !popNode->isLeaf) {
00975                         for (size_t i=0; i<popNode->objCount+1; i++) {
00976                                 if (popNode->children[i])
00977                                         qnode.push(popNode->children[i]);
00978                         }
00979 
00980                 }
00981 
00982         }
00983 
00984 }
00985 
00986 // Internal delete function, used once we've identified the
00987 // location of the node from which a key is to be deleted.
00988 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
00989                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_delete(
00990                 sdb_node* nd, const KeyType& k) {
00991         bool ret = false;
00992 
00993         // Find the object position. op will have the position
00994         // of the object in op.first, and a flag (op.second)
00995         // saying whether the object at op.first is an exact
00996         // match (true) or if the object is in a child of the
00997         // current node (false). If op.first is -1, the object
00998         // is neither in this node, or a child node.    
00999 
01000         sdb_node* node = nd;
01001         KeyType key = k;
01002         size_t _minDegree = _sfh.maxKeys/3;
01003 
01004         L0: KEYPOS op = node->findPos(key);
01005         if (op.first != (size_t)-1) // it's in there somewhere ...
01006         {
01007                 if (op.second == CCP_INTHIS) // we've got an exact match
01008                 {
01009                         // Case 1: deletion from leaf node.
01010                         if (node->isLeaf) {
01011                                 //assert(node->objCount >= _minDegree-1);
01012                                 node->delFromLeaf(op.first);
01013 
01014                                 //now node is dirty
01015                                 node->setDirty(1);
01016                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01017                                 ret = true;
01018                         }
01019                         // Case 2: Exact match on internal leaf.
01020                         else {
01021                                 // Case 2a: prior child has enough elements to pull one out.
01022                                 node->loadChild(op.first, _dataFile);
01023                                 node->loadChild(op.first+1, _dataFile);
01024                                 if (node->children[op.first]->objCount >= _minDegree) {
01025                                         sdb_node* childNode = node->loadChild(op.first, _dataFile);
01026                                         SDBCursor locn = _findPred(childNode);
01027 
01028                                         node->keys[op.first] = locn.first->keys[locn.second];
01029                                         node->values[op.first] = locn.first->values[locn.second];
01030 
01031                                         //now node is dirty
01032                                         node->setDirty(1);
01033                                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01034 
01035                                         node = childNode;
01036                                         key = locn.first->keys[locn.second];
01037                                         goto L0;
01038                                         //ret = _delete(childNode, dat.get_key());
01039                                 }
01040 
01041                                 // Case 2b: successor child has enough elements to pull one out.
01042                                 else if (node->children[op.first + 1]->objCount >= _minDegree) {
01043                                         sdb_node* childNode = node->loadChild(op.first + 1,
01044                                                         _dataFile);
01045                                         SDBCursor locn = _findSucc(childNode);
01046 
01047                                         node->keys[op.first] = locn.first->keys[locn.second];
01048                                         node->values[op.first] = locn.first->values[locn.second];
01049 
01050                                         //now node is dirty                                     
01051                                         node->setDirty(1);
01052                                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01053 
01054                                         node = childNode;
01055                                         key = locn.first->keys[locn.second];
01056                                         goto L0;
01057                                         //ret = _delete(childNode, dat.get_key());
01058                                 }
01059 
01060                                 // Case 2c: both children have only t-1 elements.
01061                                 // Merge the two children, putting the key into the
01062                                 // new child. Then delete from the new child.
01063                                 else {
01064                                         assert(node->children[op.first]->objCount == _minDegree-1);
01065                                         assert(node->children[op.first+1]->objCount == _minDegree-1);
01066                                         sdb_node* mergedChild = _merge(node, op.first);
01067                                         node = mergedChild;
01068                                         goto L0;
01069                                         //ret = _delete(mergedChild, key);
01070                                 }
01071                         }
01072                 }
01073 
01074                 // Case 3: key is not in the internal node being examined,
01075                 // but is in one of the children.
01076                 else if (op.second == CCP_INLEFT || op.second == CCP_INRIGHT) {
01077                         // Find out if the child tree containing the key
01078                         // has enough elements. If so, we just recurse into
01079                         // that child.
01080 
01081                         node->loadChild(op.first, _dataFile);
01082                         if (op.first+1<=node->objCount)
01083                                 node->loadChild(op.first+1, _dataFile);
01084                         size_t keyChildPos = (op.second == CCP_INLEFT) ? op.first
01085                                         : op.first + 1;
01086                         sdb_node* childNode = node->loadChild(keyChildPos, _dataFile);
01087                         if (childNode->objCount >= _minDegree) {
01088                                 node = childNode;
01089                                 goto L0;
01090                                 //ret = _delete(childNode, key);
01091                         } else {
01092                                 // Find out if the childNode has an immediate
01093                                 // sibling with _minDegree keys.
01094                                 sdb_node* leftSib = 0;
01095                                 sdb_node* rightSib = 0;
01096                                 size_t leftCount = 0;
01097                                 size_t rightCount = 0;
01098                                 if (keyChildPos> 0) {
01099                                         leftSib = node->loadChild(keyChildPos - 1, _dataFile);
01100                                         leftCount = leftSib->objCount;
01101                                 }
01102                                 if (keyChildPos < node->objCount) {
01103                                         rightSib = node->loadChild(keyChildPos + 1, _dataFile);
01104                                         rightCount = rightSib->objCount;
01105                                 }
01106 
01107                                 // Case 3a: There is a sibling with _minDegree or more keys.
01108                                 if (leftCount >= _minDegree || rightCount >= _minDegree) {
01109                                         // Part of this process is making sure that the
01110                                         // child node has minDegree elements.
01111 
01112                                         childNode->setCount(_minDegree);
01113 
01114                                         // Bringing the new key from the left sibling
01115                                         if (leftCount >= _minDegree) {
01116                                                 // Shuffle the keys and elements up
01117                                                 size_t i = _minDegree - 1;
01118                                                 for (; i> 0; i--) {
01119                                                         childNode->keys[i] = childNode->keys[i - 1];
01120                                                         childNode->values[i] = childNode->values[i - 1];
01121                                                         childNode->children[i + 1] = childNode->children[i];
01122                                                         if (childNode->children[i + 1]) {
01123                                                                 childNode->children[i + 1]->childNo = i + 1;
01124                                                         }
01125                                                 }
01126                                                 childNode->children[i + 1] = childNode->children[i];
01127                                                 if (childNode->children[i + 1]) {
01128                                                         childNode->children[i + 1]->childNo = i +1;
01129                                                 }
01130 
01131                                                 // Put the key from the parent into the empty space,
01132                                                 // pull the replacement key from the sibling, and
01133                                                 // move the appropriate child from the sibling to
01134                                                 // the target child.
01135 
01136                                                 childNode->keys[0] = node->keys[keyChildPos - 1];
01137                                                 childNode->values[0] = node->values[keyChildPos - 1];
01138 
01139                                                 node->keys[keyChildPos - 1]
01140                                                                 = leftSib->keys[leftSib->objCount - 1];
01141                                                 node->values[keyChildPos - 1]
01142                                                                 = leftSib->values[leftSib->objCount - 1];
01143                                                 if (!leftSib->isLeaf) {
01144                                                         childNode->children[0]
01145                                                                         = leftSib->children[leftSib->objCount];
01146                                                         childNode->children[0]->childNo = 0;
01147                                                         childNode->children[0]->parent = childNode;
01148                                                 }
01149                                                 leftSib->setCount(leftSib->objCount-1);
01150                                                 //--leftSib->objCount;
01151                                                 assert(leftSib->objCount >= _minDegree-1);
01152 
01153                                                 //now node is dirty
01154                                                 leftSib->setDirty(1);
01155                                                 node->setDirty(1);
01156                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(leftSib);
01157                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01158                                         }
01159 
01160                                         // Bringing a new key in from the right sibling
01161                                         else {
01162                                                 // Put the key from the parent into the child,
01163                                                 // put the key from the sibling into the parent,
01164                                                 // and move the appropriate child from the
01165                                                 // sibling to the target child node.
01166                                                 childNode->keys[childNode->objCount - 1]
01167                                                                 = node->keys[op.first];
01168                                                 childNode->values[childNode->objCount - 1]
01169                                                                 = node->values[op.first];
01170                                                 node->keys[op.first] = rightSib->keys[0];
01171                                                 node->values[op.first] = rightSib->values[0];
01172 
01173                                                 if (!rightSib->isLeaf) {
01174                                                         childNode->children[childNode->objCount]
01175                                                                         = rightSib->children[0];
01176 
01177                                                         childNode->children[childNode->objCount]->childNo
01178                                                                         = childNode->objCount;//wps add it!
01179                                                         childNode->children[childNode->objCount]->parent
01180                                                                         = childNode;//wps add it!
01181                                                 }
01182 
01183                                                 // Now clean up the right node, shuffling keys
01184                                                 // and elements to the left and resizing.
01185                                                 size_t i = 0;
01186                                                 for (; i < rightSib->objCount - 1; i++) {
01187                                                         rightSib->keys[i] = rightSib->keys[i + 1];
01188                                                         rightSib->values[i] = rightSib->values[i + 1];
01189                                                         if (!rightSib->isLeaf) {
01190                                                                 rightSib->children[i]
01191                                                                                 = rightSib->children[i + 1];
01192 
01193                                                                 rightSib->children[i]->childNo = i;
01194                                                         }
01195                                                 }
01196                                                 if (!rightSib->isLeaf) {
01197                                                         rightSib->children[i] = rightSib->children[i + 1];
01198                                                         rightSib->children[i]->childNo = i;
01199                                                 }
01200                                                 rightSib->setCount(rightSib->objCount - 1);
01201                                                 assert(rightSib->objCount >= _minDegree-1);
01202 
01203                                                 //now node is dirty
01204                                                 rightSib->setDirty(true);
01205                                                 node->setDirty(1);
01206                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(rightSib);
01207                                                 //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01208                                         }
01209                                         node = childNode;
01210 
01211                                         node->setDirty(true);
01212                                         //_dirtyPages.push_back(node);
01213                                         goto L0;
01214                                         //ret = _delete(childNode, key);
01215                                 }
01216 
01217                                 // Case 3b: All siblings have _minDegree - 1 keys
01218                                 else {
01219                                         assert(node->children[op.first]->objCount == _minDegree-1);
01220                                         assert(node->children[op.first+1]->objCount == _minDegree-1);
01221                                         sdb_node* mergedChild = _merge(node, op.first);
01222                                         node = mergedChild;
01223                                         goto L0;
01224                                         //ret = _delete(mergedChild, key);
01225                                 }
01226                         }
01227                 }
01228         }
01229         return ret;
01230 }
01231 
01232 // Opening the database means that we check the file
01233 // and see if it exists. If it doesn't exist, start a database
01234 // from scratch. If it does exist, load the root node into
01235 // memory.
01236 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01237                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::open() {
01238         // We're creating if the file doesn't exist.
01239 
01240         struct stat statbuf;
01241         bool creating = stat(_fileName.c_str(), &statbuf);
01242 
01243         _dataFile = fopen(_fileName.c_str(), creating ? "w+b" : "r+b");
01244         if (0 == _dataFile) {
01245 #ifdef DEBUG            
01246                 cout <<"SDB Error: open file failed, check if dat directory exists"
01247                 <<endl;
01248 #endif
01249                 return false;
01250         }
01251 
01252         // Create a new node
01253         bool ret = false;
01254         if (creating) {
01255 
01256 #ifdef DEBUG
01257                 cout<<"creating...\n"<<endl;
01258                 _sfh.display();
01259 #endif
01260 
01261                 sdb_node::initialize(_sfh.pageSize, _sfh.maxKeys);;
01262 
01263                 _sfh.toFile(_dataFile);
01264 
01265                 // If creating, allocate a node instead of
01266                 // reading one.
01267                 _root = _allocateNode();
01268                 _root->isLeaf = true;
01269                 _root->isLoaded = true;
01270 
01271                 _root->write(_dataFile);
01272                 ret = true;
01273 
01274         } else {
01275 
01276                 // when not creating, read the root node from the disk.
01277                 memset(&_sfh, 0, sizeof(_sfh));
01278                 _sfh.fromFile(_dataFile);
01279                 if (_sfh.magic != 0x061561) {
01280                         cout<<"Error, read wrong file header\n"<<endl;
01281                         assert(false);
01282                         return false;
01283                 }
01284                 if (_cacheSize != 0) {
01285                         //reset cacheSize that has been set before open.
01286                         //cacheSize is dynamic at runtime
01287                         _sfh.cacheSize = _cacheSize;
01288                 }
01289 #ifdef DEBUG
01290                 cout<<"open exist...\n"<<endl;
01291                 _sfh.display();
01292 #endif
01293 
01294                 sdb_node::initialize(_sfh.pageSize, _sfh.maxKeys);;
01295 
01296                 _root = new sdb_node;
01297                 _root->fpos = _sfh.rootPos;
01298                 _root->read(_dataFile);
01299                 //_root->display();
01300                 ret = true;
01301 
01302         }
01303         _isOpen = true;
01304         return ret;
01305 }
01306 
01307 // This is the external delete function.
01308 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01309                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::del(
01310                 const KeyType& key) {
01311 
01312         _flushCache();
01313         // Determine if the root node is empty.
01314         bool ret = (_root->objCount != 0);
01315         if (_root->objCount == (size_t) -1) {
01316                 return 0;
01317         }
01318 
01319         // If we successfully deleted the key, and there
01320         // is nothing left in the root node and the root
01321         // node is not a leaf, we need to shrink the tree
01322         // by making the root's child (there should only
01323         // be one) the new root. Write the location of
01324         // the new root to the start of the file so we
01325         // know where to look
01326         if (_root->objCount == 0 && !_root->isLeaf) {
01327                 _root = _root->children[0];
01328                 _root->parent = 0;
01329         }
01330 
01331         // If our root is not empty, call the internal
01332         // delete method on it.
01333         ret = _delete(_root, key);
01334 
01335         if (ret)
01336                 _sfh.numItems--;
01337         return ret;
01338 }
01339 
01340 // This method retrieves a record from the database
01341 // given its location.
01342 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01343                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::get(
01344                 const SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec) {
01345         if ((sdb_node*)locn.first == 0 || locn.second == (size_t)-1 || locn.second
01346                         >= locn.first->objCount) {
01347                 return false;
01348         }
01349         rec = DataType(locn.first->keys[locn.second],
01350                         locn.first->values[locn.second]);
01351         return true;
01352 }
01353 
01354 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01355                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::update(
01356                 const KeyType& key, const ValueType& value) {
01357         SDBCursor locn(NULL, (size_t)-1);
01358         if (search(key, locn) ) {
01359                 locn.first->values[locn.second] = value;
01360                 locn.first->setDirty(true);
01361                 return true;
01362         } else {
01363                 return insert(key, value);
01364         }
01365         return false;
01366 }
01367 
01368 // This method finds the record following the one at the
01369 // location given as locn, and copies the record into rec.
01370 // The direction can be either forward or backward.
01371 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01372                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::seq(
01373                 SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec, ESeqDirection sdir) {
01374         if (_sfh.numItems <=0) {
01375                 return false;
01376         }
01377         _root->parent = 0;
01378         _flushCache(locn);
01379         switch (sdir) {
01380         case ESD_FORWARD:
01381                 return _seqNext(locn, rec);
01382         case ESD_BACKWARD:
01383                 return _seqPrev(locn, rec);
01384         }
01385 
01386         return false;
01387 }
01388 
01389 // Find the next item in the database given a location. Return
01390 // the subsequent item in rec.
01391 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01392                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_seqNext(
01393                 SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec) {
01394         // Set up a couple of convenience values
01395         bool ret = false;
01396         sdb_node* node = locn.first;
01397         size_t lastPos = locn.second;
01398         bool goUp = false; // indicates whether or not we've exhausted a node.
01399 
01400         // If we are starting at the beginning, initialise
01401         // the locn reference and return with the value set.
01402         // This means we have to plunge into the depths of the
01403         // tree to find the first leaf node.
01404         if ((sdb_node*)node == 0) {
01405                 node = _root;
01406                 while ((sdb_node*)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01407                         node = node->loadChild(0, _dataFile);
01408                 }
01409                 if ((sdb_node*)node == 0) {
01410                         return false;
01411                 }
01412                 rec = DataType(node->keys[0], node->values[0]);
01413                 locn.first = node;
01414                 locn.second = 0;
01415                 return true;
01416         }
01417 
01418         // Advance the locn object to the next item
01419 
01420         // If we have a leaf node, we don't need to worry about
01421         // traversing into children ... only need to worry about
01422         // going back up the tree.
01423         if (node->isLeaf) {
01424                 // didn't visit the last node last time.
01425                 if (lastPos < node->objCount - 1) {
01426                         rec = DataType(node->keys[lastPos + 1], node->values[lastPos + 1]);
01427                         locn.second = lastPos + 1;
01428                         return true;
01429                 }
01430                 goUp = (lastPos == node->objCount - 1);
01431         }
01432 
01433         // Not a leaf, therefore need to worry about traversing
01434         // into child nodes.
01435         else {
01436                 node = node->loadChild(lastPos + 1, _dataFile);//_cacheInsert(node);
01437                 while ((sdb_node*)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01438                         node = node->loadChild(0, _dataFile);
01439                 }
01440                 if ((sdb_node*)node == 0) {
01441                         return false;
01442                 }
01443                 rec = DataType(node->keys[0], node->values[0]);
01444                 locn.first = node;
01445                 locn.second = 0;
01446                 return true;
01447         }
01448 
01449         // Finished off a leaf, therefore need to go up to
01450         // a parent.
01451         if (goUp) {
01452                 size_t childNo = node->childNo;
01453                 node = node->parent;
01454                 while ((sdb_node*)node != 0 && childNo >= node->objCount) {
01455                         childNo = node->childNo;
01456                         node = node->parent;
01457                 }
01458                 if ((sdb_node*)node != 0) {
01459                         locn.first = node;
01460                         locn.second = childNo;
01461                         ret = true;
01462                         rec = DataType(node->keys[childNo], node->values[childNo]);
01463                 }
01464         }
01465         return ret;
01466 }
01467 
01468 // Find the previous item in the database given a location. Return
01469 // the item in rec.
01470 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01471                 typename Alloc> bool sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::_seqPrev(
01472                 SDBCursor& locn, DataType& rec) {
01473         // Set up a couple of convenience values
01474 
01475         bool ret = false;
01476         sdb_node* node = locn.first;
01477         size_t lastPos = locn.second;
01478         bool goUp = false; // indicates whether or not we've exhausted a node.
01479 
01480 
01481         // If we are starting at the end, initialise
01482         // the locn reference and return with the value set.
01483         // This means we have to plunge into the depths of the
01484         // tree to find the first leaf node.
01485 
01486         if ((sdb_node*)node == 0) {
01487                 node = _root;
01488                 while ((sdb_node*)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01489                         node = node->loadChild(node->objCount, _dataFile);
01490                 }
01491                 if ((sdb_node*)node == 0) {
01492                         return false;
01493                 }
01494                 locn.first = node;
01495                 locn.second = node->objCount - 1;
01496 
01497                 if (locn.second == size_t(-1) )
01498                         return false;
01499                 rec = DataType(node->keys[locn.second], node->values[locn.second]);
01500                 return true;
01501         }
01502 
01503         // Advance the locn object to the next item
01504 
01505         // If we have a leaf node, we don't need to worry about
01506         // traversing into children ... only need to worry about
01507         // going back up the tree.
01508         if (node->isLeaf) {
01509                 // didn't visit the last node last time.
01510                 if (lastPos> 0) {
01511                         locn.second = lastPos - 1;
01512                         rec = DataType(node->keys[locn.second], node->values[locn.second]);
01513                         return true;
01514                 }
01515                 goUp = (lastPos == 0);
01516         }
01517 
01518         // Not a leaf, therefore need to worry about traversing
01519         // into child nodes.
01520         else {
01521                 node = node->loadChild(lastPos, _dataFile);
01522                 while ((sdb_node*)node != 0 && !node->isLeaf) {
01523                         node = node->loadChild(node->objCount, _dataFile);
01524                 }
01525                 if ((sdb_node*)node == 0) {
01526 
01527                         return false;
01528                 }
01529                 locn.first = node;
01530                 locn.second = node->objCount - 1;
01531                 //rec = *(node->elements[locn.second]->pdat);
01532                 rec = DataType(node->keys[locn.second], node->values[locn.second]);
01533                 return true;
01534         }
01535 
01536         // Finished off a leaf, therefore need to go up to
01537         // a parent.
01538         if (goUp) {
01539                 size_t childNo = node->childNo;
01540                 node = node->parent;
01541 
01542                 while ((sdb_node*)node != 0 && childNo == 0) {
01543                         childNo = node->childNo;
01544                         node = node->parent;
01545                 }
01546                 if ((sdb_node*)node != 0) {
01547                         locn.first = node;
01548                         locn.second = childNo - 1;
01549                         rec = DataType(node->keys[locn.second], node->values[locn.second]);
01550                         ret = true;
01551                 }
01552         }
01553         return ret;
01554 }
01555 
01556 // This method flushes all loaded nodes to the file and
01557 // then unloads the root node' children. So not only do we commit
01558 // everything to file, we also free up most memory previously
01559 // allocated.
01560 template<typename KeyType, typename ValueType, typename LockType,
01561                 typename Alloc> void sdb_btree< KeyType, ValueType, LockType, Alloc>::flush() {
01562 
01563         //write back the fileHead and dirtypage
01564         commit();
01565         // Unload each of the root's childrent. 
01566         if (_root && !_root->isLeaf) {
01567                 for (size_t i = 0; i < _root->objCount+1; i++) {
01568                         sdb_node* pChild = _root->children[i];
01569                         if ((sdb_node*)pChild != 0 && pChild->isLoaded) {
01570                                 _root->children[i]->unload();
01571                         }
01572                 }
01573         }
01574 }
01575
